translation: Two Purushas there are in this world: the perishable and the imperishable. All beings are perishable, and the Kutastha—the unchanging—is called the imperishable.
commentary: 15.16 Two two? Imou these? Purushas (beings)? People in the world? The letter the perishable? f and? The letter the imperishable? Eve even? f and? The letter the perishable? All of them all? Bhootani beings? Kutasthaḥ the immutable (unchanging)? The letter the imperishable? Ucyate is called.Commentary Now the Lord describes the three aspects of the divine existence. One is the individual soul called the perishable? the
